text: No its on almost all pages <@U3T21PDBK>

Reminder: Did you know you can message <@U02162GK9SP|sprocky> at any time to get HubSpot development questions answered? It’s an experimental chat bot built to tackle developer questions. It won’t read your code, but can answer a lot of questions about building on the HubSpot platform.

The term "overloading" or "overloaded data/fields" comes up all the time in a COTS solution like HubSpot. Companies will use an object/field that they aren't using (like WhatsUp or SMS) instead of creating a custom objects. The info and examples of when to and when not to are good Create and edit custom objects (<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com><https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/create-custom-objects#before-you-get-started|)>. Does anyone have any experience or limitations they've run into when creating custom objects. Some have said that HubSpot only lets you create one Custom Object per license?

Hi! I am new to HubSpot. I am trying to update the work hours in the global footer. The hours are not hardcoded in there. Basically, there is a div with a class of "office-hours" and then inside that is a span tag with a class called "WEEKDAY_OPERATING_HOURS". Can someone please direct me as to where I might find the code that updates the span tag?

I did find a javascript file that has this piece of code.
```  xhttp.open("GET", "/hours-of-operation", true);```
However, not sure what "/hours-of-operation" is or where to find it? I am assuming it is a json file.

Hi Lara,

Based on your ajax request down below it looks like this is trying to query a specific page within your portal. grabbing office hours from something on that page perhaps. Here is a list of all of the various <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables|Hubl variables> you can access on a page. If it was native to HubSpot it would be on this list.

Sounds to me like youre using a custom theme and or custom footer module in order to make the office hours piece work.
Anyone know why the "Edit for desktop/mobile" toggle is missing in the editor for me?
Here's what it should look like:
I figured it out. You need to make sure you have this section in your theme.json
